unittitle.value:
<emph render="italic">This Week</emph> and 
                <emph render="italic">The Clubwomen's World</emph> magazine collection

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
<emph render="italic">This Week</emph>, later titled 
                <emph render="italic">The Clubwomen's World</emph>, was a weekly women's magazine published in Brooklyn during the late 1920s and 1930s. Initially containing only social news relating to Brooklyn Heights, the magazine later expanded its coverage to include social news relating to additional Brooklyn neighborhoods, the activities of Brooklyn women's clubs, and the greater New York City area. This collection contains several issues of 
                <emph render="italic">This Week</emph> and 
                <emph render="italic">The Clubwomen's World</emph> spanning the period March 10, 1928 to March 25, 1933.

p.value: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

<emph render="italic">This Week</emph>, later titled 
                <emph render="italic">The Clubwomen's World</emph>, was a weekly women's magazine published in Brooklyn during the late 1920s and 1930s. Initially containing only social news relating to Brooklyn Heights, the magazine later expanded its coverage to include social news relating to additional Brooklyn neighborhoods, the activities of Brooklyn women's clubs, and the greater New York City area. The magazine was edited by Lee M. Pasquin and published by Gertrude Morrison Fisher.

This collection contains issues of the Brooklyn weekly women's magazine, 
                <emph render="italic">This Week</emph>, spanning the period March 10, 1928 to March 25, 1933. Issues dating from January 14, 1933 to March 25, 1933 carry the magazine's later name, 
                <emph render="italic">The Clubwomen's World</emph>. The magazines contain social news relating to several Brooklyn neighborhoods and the greater New York City area, with a focus on the activities of various women's clubs. While the collection contains most issues of the magazine published during the aforementioned date range, a small number of issues are absent.
